question_sentence: President Biden signed a historic COVID-19 relief bill Thursday. Under the bill, who would be ineligible for a stimulus check based on income?

The juror selection has started for the trial of former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin, who is facing third-degree murder charges in the death of George Floyd last May. How long is the selection process expected to take?
You might be one of the 18.8% of Americans who have received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine. Congrats! Now, what does the CDC say you CAN do once you’ve been fully vaccinated?
choices: Attend indoor gatherings of two or more unvaccinated households
Not get tested for COVID-19 even after exposure, unless you’re symptomatic
Travel to countries with COVID-19 variants
Stop taking your annual flu shot

question_sentence: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry spent hours answering questions from Oprah in a bombshell interview that aired on CBS Sunday. Which royal family member said they were “very much not a racist family” this week in response to the interview?
How many Senate Republicans voted for the Biden administration’s COVID-19 relief package?
choices: Three: Lisa Murkowski, Pat Toomey and Todd Young
Two: Dan Sullivan and Roger Marshall

question_sentence: Who was confirmed as the United States’ Attorney General this week?

Richard Barnett is one of the people who stormed the Capitol on Jan. 6. An image of him propping his feet up on Nancy Pelosi’s desk while he was at the Capitol went viral. What happened at his trial this week?
choices: His Zoom virtual background was a picture of him storming the Capitol.
He yelled at the judge out of anger that he was still in jail
He propped his feet up on his own desk at home

question_sentence: In Oklahoma, Republican lawmakers approved House Bill 1674 along party lines. What would it do?
choices: Protect drivers who hit protesters with their cars
Decrease funding for body cams for police officers
Allow police to arrest media covering a protest

question_sentence: Andrea Sahouri, a Des Moines Register reporter, was just acquitted of both misdemeanor charges against her after she was arrested covering a protest for racial justice last summer. What were the charges?
choices: Assaulting a police officer and trespassing
Failure to disperse and interference with official acts
Not listening to a government official and inciting a riot
Inciting a riot and destroying property

question_sentence: Which of these is NOT a risk factor for being a COVID-19 long-hauler?
choices: More than five symptoms during COVID-19 infection

question_sentence: Which tech tycoon triggered a bidding frenzy by putting the first message they ever posted on their social media platform ‘up for sale’ in an online auction?
Nicola Sturgeon has criticised ‘selfish’ fans of which football club for breaking Covid restrictions by gathering to celebrate their Scottish Premiership victory?
Which country is the latest to join the growing list of nations that ban the burka, following a referendum on wearing the face coverings in public?
Which of the following phrases did the Queen use in her brief statement responding to allegations of racism in the Royal Family?
What is the name of the upcoming film produced by Downing Street celebrating the UK’s vaccine rollout?
choices: A Beacon of Hope: the UK Vaccine Story
A New Hope: the Story of a Vaccine
A Year of Tragedy: the UK and Covid-19
The Whitty Files: Inside the UK’s Covid Response

question_sentence: Which senior EU official has faced a furious response from Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab after accusing the UK of an ‘outright ban’ on Covid vaccine exports?
Russia is joining forces with which other country to build a lunar base on the surface of the Moon?
Which European country this week announced plans to open its borders in May to UK holidaymakers who have been vaccinated against or tested negative for Covid?
Which investor has become the sixth member of the so-called $100bn club?
A Brazil Supreme Court judge this week annulled corruption charges against which former president?
According to State Department officials, which country is actively using online platforms to spread disinformation about two coronavirus vaccines currently approved in the United States?
evidence: Russia is accused of using three separate online platforms to spread disinformation about the Pfizer and Moderna vaccines, presumably in an attempt to promote the Russian-made Sputnik V vaccine.

question_sentence: The United States announced a cost-sharing agreement to continue housing 28,500 overseas US troops as part of the so-called Special Measures Agreement. Which other country was part of the deal?
evidence: The United States and South Korea finally agreed on the terms of the pact, solidifying US troops’ presence on the Korean peninsula. The agreement had been significantly strained during the Trump administration.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden signed the $1.9 trillion stimulus bill into law. What’s the legislation’s formal name?
evidence: The nearly two-trillion-dollar legislation is known as the American Rescue Plan, ultimately bringing stimulus checks of up to $1400 to many Americans, extending unemployment benefits and expanding the reach of child tax credits.

question_sentence: Merrick Garland was confirmed by the Senate to take on which government position?
evidence: In a 70-30 vote, Merrick Garland, a former chief judge of the US Court of Appeals for the DC Circuit, was confirmed as US attorney general. President Obama had tapped Garland in 2016 to fill a vacancy on the US Supreme Court, but Republicans in the Senate refused to hold a vote on his nomination.

question_sentence: This week marked the one-year anniversary of the novel coronavirus being declared a global pandemic by the World Health Organization. How many people have since died around the world since the start of the outbreak?
evidence: More than 2.6 million people worldwide have succumbed to the disease and 118 million people have tested positive for the virus. The US leads the global count with more than 530,000 deaths and 29 million cases reported.

question_sentence: Prince Harry and wife Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, sat down with Oprah for a highly anticipated interview discussing the royal family. According to a statement following the interview, which issues raised were “particularly” concerning for the Queen?
evidence: Prince Harry and Meghan, whose mother is Black, discussed many issues during the interview. But Meghan’s allegations of underlying racism among members of the royal family drew the most attention, leading Buckingham Palace to publicly respond.

question_sentence: The United States, India, Japan and Australia held a virtual meeting. What’s the nickname of the four-country group?
evidence: The four-country alliance is referred to as the “Quad” and all its members share an interest in curbing heightened tensions with China. According to the White House, the summit will also include discussion of Covid-19, economic cooperation and the climate crisis.

question_sentence: In his first prime-time address, President Biden directed US states to have Covid-19 vaccination opportunities available for all adults by which date?
evidence: Biden urged the states to make vaccination opportunities available to all adults by May 1, adding that if that happens and Americans remain diligent about safety, a more normal July 4th holiday could be possible.

question_sentence: Which streaming service is testing a new method to prevent password sharing with individuals “beyond your household,” a breach of the company’s terms of service?
evidence: Netflix will be testing the feature on its TV app, utilizing a two-factor system to verify that viewers are authorized to watch on the account.

question_sentence: According to a newly published report in Current Biology, certain species of which type of sea animal can regrow their bodies following self-decapitation?
evidence: Two species of sea slugs were found to be able to decapitate themselves and subsequently regrow their bodies. Though the reason is unknown, the process is similar to other species that rid themselves of body parts to remove internal parasites.
